summary: This document is a chain of emails from July-August 2021 between U.S. Attorney's Office (SDNY) personnel and a FedEx paralegal regarding obtaining a records custodian and shipping records for the Ghislaine Maxwell trial. The emails discuss locating FedEx account data for Jeffrey Epstein and Ghislaine Maxwell, preparing a declaration, and potential trial testimony.

persons.name: Tracy Chapell
persons.role: Senior Paralegal, Federal Express Corporation Legal Department
persons.context: FedEx employee communicating with the U.S. Attorney's Office about providing shipping records and a potential records custodian affidavit/testimony for the Ghislaine Maxwell trial. She provides shipment data from 2007-2020.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Subject of the upcoming trial in New York mentioned as the reason for the records request. Her FedEx account data is being sought.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Deceased financier whose FedEx account data is being sought by the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Maxwell trial. Tracy Chapell asks if this is 'the' Jeffrey Epstein.

persons.name: Tracy Ferrara
persons.context: Identified as the FedEx point of contact for a subpoena from the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of Florida in February 2008.

connections.description: Both are subjects of the same FedEx records search by prosecutors, indicating their accounts/data are linked in the investigation.
Chapell, as a FedEx paralegal, is providing records and potential testimony regarding Maxwell's shipping data for her criminal trial.
Chapell is providing records and inquiring about Epstein's account in response to the prosecution's subpoena.

events.title: SD Florida Subpoena to FedEx
events.description: The U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of Florida sent a subpoena to FedEx, with Tracy Ferrara as the point of contact.

events.title: Ghislaine Maxwell Trial Scheduled
events.description: The trial for Ghislaine Maxwell was scheduled to start in New York in November 2021.

events.title: Discovery Production for Maxwell Trial
events.description: The U.S. Attorney's Office (SDNY) is coordinating with FedEx to obtain shipping records and a records custodian declaration for the Maxwell trial discovery.

locations: Memphis, TN 38125 (FedEx Legal Department, 3620 Hack Cross Road Building B, 3rd Floor)
New York, New York 10007 (U.S. Attorney's Office, SDNY, 1 Saint Andrews Plaza)
keyFacts: Prosecutors were seeking FedEx shipping records from 2007-2020 for accounts associated with Jeffrey Epstein and Ghislaine Maxwell.
A FedEx paralegal confirmed the records existed and was prepared to provide an affidavit or testify at Maxwell's trial.
The records request was part of discovery for the Ghislaine Maxwell trial scheduled for November 2021 in New York.
A previous subpoena for FedEx records was issued by the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of Florida in February 2008.
The email chain shows coordination between the SDNY and a corporate records custodian to authenticate evidence for trial.
